descriptionHTML:
Weather and Radar, just a glimpse away.

Aeris Wear brings weather and radar to your wrist:
- Instant access to current weather conditions, short-term and extended forecasts makes it easy to plan for this afternoon, tomorrow, or the weekend.
- Rain or snow boots? Be prepared with local and regional radar.
- Immediate severe weather advisories and alerts for your location sent straight to your device.
- Automatic weather and radar updates, right on the wear device!

Radar & Advisories are for the US only and satellite available globally. Be on the look out for new global layers and card options coming soon!

Upgrade to Pro!
Personalize your weather content with the Aeris Wear Pro upgrade! You'll have access to all 9 of our cards and the ability to customize your card order. The Pro upgrade features all cards offered in the free version plus makes satellite and advisory cards available. Upgrading can be conveniently done within Aeris Wear for only $0.99.
comments: Great app though not sure how to rearrange the cards. No sound with alerts or a way to change the vibration  to indicate it is something urgent.

Description of the Pro features is very misleading:  "Personalize your weather content with the Aeris Wear Pro upgrade! You'll have access to all 9 of our cards and the ability to customize your card order."  Once you upgrade to Pro you still do not have the option to change the first 3 cards. Wish my purchase was still within the refund window...

I do like this App with one exception, the 'Maps' don't work at all, the App just crashes, and has to be restarted. Considering I have the latest top of the range Sony Xperia XZ Premium (although it does not work on the Sony Xperia Z5 either) I wonder how it works at all on lesser spec'd machines.  UPDATE : Having got a reply from the developers today I looked at the app again on my phone, (the above problem was on the phone app) and for some reason (magic ?) it is working perfectly, so I then turned to my Sony Smartwatch 3 (it doesn't run Wear v2 by the way) and it works perfectly on that too.  I must admit I had not checked or used it since I first reported the problem, but all is well now and of course I have now given it the 5 stars it deserves. Thanks to the developer for the reply though - I do feel a little guilty for not checking it before now though although there has been no updates to Aeris, there have been a couple of Android updates, but it still remains a mystery as to why it didn't work initially.
Good app but I wish there was a little more information, like percent chance it'll rain. The radar takes forever to load too
Looks nice, reasonable features.  BUT very suspect why it wants access to contacts and phone though, and it doesn't start without these permissions.
